channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Numerous bags fly tipped, 16th February
item.description:
We’re there at 8am 16/2/22
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 93 Sussex Gardens, Hucclecote

item.title: Drains from gotherington cross garage blocke, 16th February
item.description:
Drains that are set into kerbstones are blocked with mud and grass from gotherington cross garage just before old council allotments
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A435, Gotherington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pair of potholes on Tennyson Road near mini roundabout, 16th February
item.description:
These have opened up in the existing repairs and must be at least 8 cm deep

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 65 Tennyson Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on Tennyson Road just on approach to roundabout, 16th February
item.description:
The road is opened up between the two patches of repairs, it is more than 7 1/2 cm deep, and it is directly in the path of cyclists approaching the roundabout safely. Please fix urgently

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Brooklyn Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 15th February
item.description:
Drain water is coming up through the grill and flowing across the Cirencester road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Forden House Timbercombe Lane, Charlton Kings

item.title: Lamposts not working, 15th February
item.description:
Lamp posts 3738, 3739 and 3740 aren’t working and is making it really difficult when joining the road from the roundabout. 3 other lots are also not working. This has been the case for at least the last 3 weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass on pavement, 15th February
item.description:
There's a broken glass bottle strewn across the pavement of Hatherley Court Road, just near the corner with St Stephen's Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 17 Hatherley Court Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor and illegal parking, 15th February
item.description:
Person parked and fully blocking pavement where double yellow lines exist. When asked to move so I could safely pass she declined telling me I am selfish. I pointed out the P&R across the road and was shouted at. As I passed on the very wet verge I slipped and nearly injured myself on her car. This is a violation of parking laws as there are double yellow lines in this location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Fiddler's Green Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Complete mess at rear of properties on Lloyd Close, 15th February
item.description:
Abysmal litter / bins mess

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 20a Lloyd Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in road, 15th February
item.description:
On southbound side of road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Dormer Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Flooded path, 15th February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Hazlitt Croft, Cheltenham

item.title: Potholes, 14th February
item.description:
At least three large potholes down Fairhaven Avenue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 68 Boverton Drive, Brockworth

item.title: Earth dropped on pavement and road, 14th February
item.description:
Earth is being dropped on the road and pavement, from the current development. No attempt has been made to clean it up. In addition to the vehicles regularly being parked on the pavement (van, earth moving lorries, developers), this is regularly obstructing the pavement, particularly for some members of the community.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Two Gables Hailes Street, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fairhaven Avenue needs re painting, 14th February
item.description:
The Fairhaven Avenue street sign needs re painting as it is extremely difficult for people to read
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 Fairhaven Avenue, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large bag of rubbish by bench after parish council litter pick, 13th February
item.description:
I organised a parish council litter pick. We have put all other bags into the large waste bin at swindon village hall. This needs emptying. There is 1 remaining bag at the memorial bench on manor road green area, with rubbish removed from the watercourse that I was not able to put in the village Hall bin. Please arrange for this to be collected by Ubico.. In addition, there is fly tipping behind the electricity substation on the other side of manor road and also at the entrance to dog bark lane. Please have the same team remove this. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Manor Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes, 12th February
item.description:
Multiple potholes on beeches close. Dangerous to cyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Birch Close, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speeding cars, 10th February
item.description:
Typhoon Way is becoming a speedway for boy racers. Won't be long before there's a serious accident. Lived here 13 years, never see any police presence here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 27 Typhoon Way, Abbeymead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Discarded Dog Poo Bags by Dog Walkers, 10th February
item.description:
The location is Ham Lane Charlton Kings. The area is now walked by a relatively high number of Dog Walkers. It seems that while they are picking up their dogss poo - they are then throwing the bags in the hedges and on the verges. The location of this particualr pile is on the right hand side going down Ham Lane and opposite the Telephone pool that is on the edge of the car park area. Please can this mess be cleared up. Other examples have already been picked up by residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cornerstone Ham Lane, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet
